website_summaries.verdict: While they're light on extras, the well-priced HiFiMan RE-400s offer excellent, accurate sound that's aimed at audiophiles on a budget.
pros: The affordable HiFiMan RE-400 In-Ear Monitor earphones have an attractive, understated design with machined-aluminum earpieces
They're lightweight and comfortable to wear and offer exceptionally pure and refined sound
cons: No inline remote/microphone for cell phone calls

customer_reviews.title: Bad product. Please reconsider your decision if you are thinking about buying this.
customer_reviews.text: Old Review: Good sound quality but extremely uncomfortable to wear. Updated: Beyond the discomfort in wearing and it constantly falling off, the earphones have fallen apart, part by part. First it started with a bend in the wire. And within a day the skin there tore. Although it works the bend cannot be fixed because the wires somehow expanded more than the fabric. Next, the left ear stops working abruptly now and then. Of course I know that is indication that the life of these earphones are coming to an end. So really. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: NV

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is great, very balanced and nuanced. If this was for sound quality only I'd give 5 stars. However, the durability is not that amazing. I had one of the cords start to pull out of the earbud after about a year. Some super glue fixed that problem, but it really shouldn't have been one in the first place at this price point. If you want more isolation, there are foam tips you can buy to replace the rubber ones that come with the headphones and they offer a lot of sound absorption. I highly recommend them if you want isolation so you don't have to listen to your coworkers but keep the volume reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For about $50 you really can't beat them. They're rather neutral, so if you prefer a certain sound type you'll need to work out the levels on your own (if you're used to bass-y headphones as many are then it may be a little bit of an adjustment). Finally started to lose a bit of sound on one side after a bit over 2 years of daily, heavy use. Even so, still no fraying or wear on the braided cord or exposed wires near the jack or buds. Just really well made for the price point.
customer_reviews.author: S.R.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent build, design, and sound.
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface this by saying I own a small studio and have very nice studio monitors, and several pair of studio quality headphones. These little earbuds sound GREAT. No, they don't have a weird boosted bass response, or a awkward sharp high end. They simply do a fantastic job of reproducing the sound as the artist or producer intended. They've been my goto for over a year now and have held up. They are zero worse for wear. I'm honestly a little perplexed as to how these aren't rated higher. Three Year Update: Still my daily go to for the gym and running. Still sound, and work great. Longest lasting headphones I've ever had.
customer_reviews.author: K. Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome upgrade over stock headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Sound good but was unable to trigger my LG G6+ into HIFI dac mode... My phone considers the headphones Normal... My phone also considers my Audio Technica m50x Normal headphones also . . . A little disappointing but considering sound quality... It's lots better than stock headphones that came with the phone. I was able hear some sound separation like my Sennheiser 6XX... Considering these are in ear headphones VS my open-back Sennheiser 6XX These in ear headphones are indeed more than meets the eye.
customer_reviews.author: MrZ

customer_reviews.title: Great sound , Good comfort , Recommended buy .
customer_reviews.text: I own variety of headphones and earphones - he-4xx , hifiman Ananda , Philips shp 9500, Audio techinica m40x, Audio technica A2000z, Audeze isine 10 .From all of them, I choose to use the hifiman Ananda when I am at home, and the RE-400 when I am outside. They re-400 sounds better then all my headphones with the exception of the Ananda and he-4xx. Yes, they also sounds better then the Audeze isine 10 which cost 10 times more, and they also more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: These unassuming little headphones are awesome! Durability is pretty good. The wrapping on the cord makes tangles less likely to happen. The ear buds are small and stay in ear fairly well with the right rubber tip. The only thing that has happened is the left cable guide has separated from the ear bud, but this is fixable, and may have been an accident on my part. The sound quality is nice and balanced with the audio nestling comfortably in the center and allowing most voices to come through with clarity and some warmth.
customer_reviews.author: Merin

customer_reviews.title: I've had two pairs of these over 4 years, and for the price they're near unbeatable
customer_reviews.text: The first pair of the I had lasted for 2 years and I used the crap out of them, they only broke because I accidentally tripped on the cord and yanked the entire earpiece off. The sound quality is ridiculously impressive for $45, not very base-heavy but such incredibly clear mids and highs. I've probably put 5,000+ hours on this second pair and they're still going strong. I've never had headphones work for even half the amount of time that these have.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: The sound reproduction of these earbuds are great. I used them with Comply noise canceling Foam Tips which block out most noise. Sound quality- 5/5 For the price the sound is excellent. They don't deliver as much bass as I prefer when listening to rap, but overall the sound quality is great. Build quality- 4/5 These stood up to daily use by me for 2 to 3 months and I am somewhat rough on everything. One of the plastic pieces around the cord attached to the earbuds broke off. Taste- 5/5 My dog ate the earbuds right off the cords, apparently they were delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: Amazing overall sound, strong in sharp tones, weak in bass.
customer_reviews.text: The sharper tones are extremely crisp, so much so that I hear new harmonies in songs I've listened to 100 times. Overall sound quality is great, however deep tones like bass arent very noticeable. Still, I would say they sound significantly better than anything even remotely in their price range. P.S., I would happily pay alot more for a full metal body instead of the plastic additions HiFiMan.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Palma

customer_reviews.title: Super sound for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Love the headphone, fairly comfortable. Only two trips with it but I do not see any quality issues as reported by some others. It could be my imagination but I think it took a few hours to break in. I was not initially enamored by the sound, but after about 8 hours of play time I really came to like it. Amazing for the price, different balance then the Shure's (at twice the price of this HiFiMan) that I somehow lost but just as enjoyable. Good isolation for flying on airplanes.
customer_reviews.author: RayL

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my wife to wear on her NY Bus/Subway commute. They have basically changed her life. She has started to enjoy the commute (which really bothered her before), and she is building Spotify playlists. She comes home humming a tune. These seem to block out external noise very well. So far they are holding up fine (about two months of daily commuting).
customer_reviews.author: rbcnew

customer_reviews.title: For price, slamdunk. Learn how to resolder/replace a jack though...
customer_reviews.text: So I have probably had at least five pairs of these exact same earbuds. For the price, you really can't beat the quality. Sounds great, nicely noise cancelling, but don't make you feel like someone over-stuffed your ear canal. Only problem, on every. Single. Pair I have ever had, the wiring in the jack comes loose after about 6 months of wear. You know, the whole holding-it-at-a-precise-angle-so-it-won't-fizzle-out thing. Now, for someone with a soldering iron, that's a $5 fix and well worth this crazy low price point. For everyone else, I would consider getting heat-shrink tubing to reinforce the jack, or wrap some electrical tape around it, or think about a different pair.
customer_reviews.author: Niniel

customer_reviews.title: Worst sound quality ever
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst earbuds I have ever owned. The sound quality is much worse than the earbuds that came with my iPhone. Not just a little bit worse but a lot worse. These things have no bass and no mid range. The just sound awe full. I’ll be sending these right back. I’m amazed, I didn’t know earbuds could be this bad.
customer_reviews.author: MaDa

customer_reviews.title: Sound great but poor design; prepare to replace them annually
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these 2 years ago. Sound is excellent but in a few months of gentle use, the dreaded ubiquitous strain relief fracture occurred. I received a replacement and 1 year later same thing happened again. Customer support said I'm out of warranty and are unwilling to replace. I explained that this is clearly a known issue and they should support their merchandise but they refused. Too bad; seems like a fairly easy product defect to fix. I strongly advise against purchasing these unless you want to replace them annually.
customer_reviews.author: M Stamm

customer_reviews.title: Lacked bass response
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with these earbuds. The mid-range in a high-rise we're decent, as expected for the price, bass response very disappointing. Tried numerous sets of silicone cushions to get the best possible sound but it was a disappointment. Ended up returning them in favor of Betron ysm1000 which I am very pleased with.
customer_reviews.author: BilboBeee

customer_reviews.title: Stunning clarity of sound, but flat bass
customer_reviews.text: I can’t remember the last time I had headphones that reproduced recorded sound as faithfully as these do. I’m listening to albums I’ve known inside and out for 20+ through these headphones, and I can hear things I swear I never heard before. Truly remarkable. My only complaint is the bass sound is rather thin, and I’ve tried switching the rubber pads out thinking maybe I just needed to use a different pair, to no avail. I know having a snug fit is important to bass delivery, but I can’t seem to make it happen with these. Otherwise, they’re the best earbuds I’ve had in years.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Field

customer_reviews.title: Quality doesn't last!!
customer_reviews.text: At first, these worked well; but four months later, they're hardly working at all! Even with the sound turned all the way up, you can hardly hear anything. They still look great, no visible damage or wear, but the sound just gradually got fainter and fainter. I paid more for these hoping for better quality than drugstore earbuds, but have been very disappointed in the durability!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Poncavage

customer_reviews.title: Good vocals
customer_reviews.text: These are good for vocals and pitches higher than that. I had a previous set pro tested and their frequency response was nearly the same for each earpiece. This was a surprise to the company rep. The line connecting to the IEM does transmit some noise which is normal at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Joe W

customer_reviews.title: Very good/balanced headphones
customer_reviews.text: These sound very good. Very balanced and nice detail. Not super powerful bass but very balanced/good bass. I use these both for listening to music and playing on stage. They aren't quite as good as my old Ultimate Ears, but those were 2-3x as costly. They have been very reliable and they have the best fit of any IEM I've used ; they seal well and I angle the back to be snug against the bottom part of my ear. The only challenge I have had is when using this as an IEM when playing bass guitar. The bass comes thru but it's not very loud. However, I think more specialized headphones would be needed to get better bass response.
customer_reviews.author: amolnar

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: They sound fantastic. Really. Sound isolation is solid, as well. Left ear cut out within 10 hours of usage. All I do is run in them. Very disappointed in the structural quality of the headphones. Also, the cloth coating on the cable causes it to kink a LOT. Over the last three years I have had 7 sets of this headphone. Yes, 7. Every single one has failed. At this point I am simply eating the cost and saying that I will no longer purchase HiFiMan products, because they are built like garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Av8

customer_reviews.title: impactful bass that plays nicely with jazz
customer_reviews.text: These headphones provide a lovely, balanced, and clear sound. They definitely hit above their price point in the sound quality department. The highs are crystal clear and the mids are just a step behind. There is a clear, impactful bass that plays nicely with jazz, rock, and hip hop equally well. I will say though that the build quality leaves a lot to be desired. After owning these for about a year, I've had them replaced twice by HiFiMan due to the sound cutting out from one of the earbuds. While their customer service is top notch, I have to express skepticism towards their quality assurance and build quality.
customer_reviews.author: oydannyboy611

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Not rugged construction though.
customer_reviews.text: The bass is defined and the mids and highs are great. However, they lasted for about 21 months before the connector started getting spotty and cutting out. Too bad, I really enjoyed the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Anna E. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: great, durable, comfortable ear buds
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced, comfortable ear buds with decent clarity and acoustic response. I'm not an audiophile, but these are better than most I've tried including more expensive units.
customer_reviews.author: swpearce

customer_reviews.title: Been a couple years now and they are still my earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: Granted I've replaced the silicone inserts with foam ones many many many times. But the cord and sound are still very good. I will only replace once I give up on my old iPod that doesn't have Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: J. W. Combes

customer_reviews.title: Awful sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sounded awful, I've heard better 6$ ones from Walmart. I was seriously disappointed and ate the money to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher George

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic !
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while for the break-in and getting the right fit, but after I did, they sound great! I listen to them every day at work and they are comfortable to wear for three or four hours at a time, maybe more... Not great sound isolation, but I need to hear some sound at work, just not all of it-loud environment! Worth it, for sure. I wear them so much the connection to the earbud is starting to come loose a bit. I wear them with the cord around the top of the ear and the buds dropped in, great for office of home casual listening. For the airplane or the gym, you'll probably want to go with something different.
customer_reviews.author: S. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Started seeing physical damage after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: After 2 weeks of use, the headphones showed signs of physical damage. The cable started coming out of it's braided cord, and the L/R markers by the earbuds broke off. Physical damage aside, the headphones still work. I have no issues with the audio quality. However, the physical deterioration is a deal-breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Stevoisiak

customer_reviews.title: Better than the the Amazon reviews say.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on launch day and have always kept them in an egg-sized UE case with my commuting gear. They sound incredible for the price which was double what they are as of this review. I wear them with the smallest ear tips and over my ears to reduce cable movement noise. They're also on the InnerFidelity Wall of Fame, not sure why they're poorly reviewed here.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Konkol

customer_reviews.title: bright and lack mid-range to low end presence.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones yield a bright sound that lacks mid-range to bass presence. This is in comparison to rather wonderful Usher desktop speakers and Ultimate Ear ear buds (which are bit heavy toward the low end, but much better overall than HiFiMan RE-400s). With optimism that a better sound can be had for the money, I'm sending the HiFiMan ear buds back. On the positive side, the ear buds are quite and comfortable. I wanted to like them.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Odom

customer_reviews.title: Unexpectedly great sound and poor build quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought the HiFiMan RE-400 headphones as an extra pair of headphones to keep at work. I have a pair of full size HiFiMan headphones at home, and figured that - for $80 - the RE-400 were a safe bet. I wasn't expecting very much in terms of sound quality, but they were surprisingly good, and I even started to prefer their sound over my (slightly more expensive) Etymotic HF5s. Unfortunately, despite only occasional usage away from my desk, the left ear stopped working after only 2 months. For the price, this was unexpected - I've had $20 headphones last much longer. I would recommend these headphones for the sound, but the build quality is clearly lacking.
customer_reviews.author: S. Roy

customer_reviews.title: Good not great
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice quality and certainly the most comfortable IEMs I have used. They are attractive looking and have a premium feel. The sound quality is good, particularly the mid range, although I was expecting a little more for the money. Comparing them to say Xiaomi Pistons II, which are a price point below these, I don't think there is much if any of a gain in sound quality, but definite gains in build quality. I would summarize as saying these are good but not great for the pricetag, and you can probably find better performance in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Dugre

customer_reviews.title: Solid earphones for the money
customer_reviews.text: They fit well and sound great. Very clear and faithful sound reproduction. Like other reviews, if overbearing bass is your thing look elsewhere. Bass is not weak by any means, just not overdone. Others have said they fall apart after a few months of use, my experience has been the opposite. They have held up very well if you pull the earplugs and boots, not the cables.
customer_reviews.author: Cali B

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase, better than the first one
customer_reviews.text: Second time bought it, because the first one is dead thanks to my cat. Compare to the first one I bought, the packaging is improved, and the quality of the earphone remained as good as the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding earbuds!
customer_reviews.text: I need earbuds that are good at isolating noise, comfortable and sound good. This is because I use them on 10 to 13-hour transoceanic flights, and sometimes I have them in for almost the entire trip. These fit the bill! I am impressed with how they perform all three of my requirements: sound quality, comfort and noise isolation. I highly recommend these. And they DO come with a case!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacking bass, and substance...
customer_reviews.text: The RE-400 suffers from a lack of almost any bass so I would not reccomend them to listen to: rock, pop, jazz, or any music that has bass, voice or percussion. If this is what the "experts" call an analitical earphone it is sinonimous of a lack of substance in all departments. Save you forty bucks and buy something cheap for $8 that probably render your music better.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo Jose Lopez S

customer_reviews.title: Great value, on par with Sony XBA-4s
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a pair of Sony XBA-4s (which retail for $300+) which I loved. After they kicked the dirt after about a year and a half I went shopping for some new more affordable buds and found these recommended on an audiophile forum. I'm quite happy with my purchase - sound-wise they sound about the same to me as my XBA-4s, which is quite awesome. Lots of detail and clarity. Pros - Great sound quality - Good variety of bud attachments (I especially like the sort of double-ball ones) - Very lightweight Cons - Feel a bit fragile - No microphone or volume control
customer_reviews.author: Joel D

customer_reviews.title: Second Pair Failure
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these headphones have failed for me twice. The first was the right headphone, the second was the left. I do really like the HiFiMan RE-400 -- the looks and the sound -- but I can't recommend them. For the first failure I contacted the company and sent me a new pair. I've had the second pair for under a year, and they are beginning to fail. It seems that they fail where the wire connects to the speaker housing. The price is good, but not worth contacting support every time the headphones quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Simple, but great
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight with a great sound stage. I will give it a five star if it was easier to determine the left and right ears.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great sound while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality for these is great. Very flat and balanced with perhaps a little high end emphasis similar to AKG or Sennheiser full size headphones. Personally I prefer that sound so it was perfect. Unfortunately the build quality was bad on my pair. After about 2-3 months the cord on the right ear started to pull out of the housing, causing static from the driver and actually sometimes a slight physical shock to my ear. I'd be willing to pay 20-30 bucks more to get the build quality that this sound deserves. Shame since it's hard to find flat-sound IEMs.
customer_reviews.author: Josh C.

customer_reviews.title: Can't find a device these sound good with
customer_reviews.text: They don't sound good with my Samsung Galaxy phone, my iPod, or even videos on my Kindle. I shall continue searching. Maybe they need a headphone amp to come alive. I've tried the various earpieces. They're lacking in midrange, or high end... something. They just sound dead.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Parker

customer_reviews.title: A classic, vocal forward top quality IEM, on sale!
customer_reviews.text: These are my 2nd pair had the others for many years now. These are forward in the vocals but not bright but balanced. & definitely not bassy. the focus is on vocal clarity.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Pastore

customer_reviews.title: Good sounding noise cancleing ear bud.
customer_reviews.text: update purchased May 2015. Update after owning them since June of 2015. The cable system do not hold up to normal wear and tear. The wires are showing where they go into the ear buds. I would of hoped for better quality. I took good care of these and they just seemed to of wore out with very careful use. I have gone back to using my Klipsh IEM's The sound quality was good but the build quality has a long way to go for IEM's in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Happyguy

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: The build quality, fit and finish is no better than “ok”. The maker, HiFi Man has a great reputation in the headphone market, but not these headphones. Like the build, the sound was no better than “ok”. Not that good.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Had the previous version of these and they were great, but as with most in-ear headphones those eventually ...
customer_reviews.text: Had the previous version of these and they were great, but as with most in-ear headphones those eventually stopped working due to detached wiring. Part of the reason was the rubber cording, which these smartly replaced with fabric. It makes them quieter and more durable. They light, comfortable thanks to the variety of ear pieces and sound great. The metal shell also look cool. Worth the investment as cheap (<$50) headphone fall apart so easily thanks to thin wiring and cheap adhesives.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great In-Ear Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones make a big difference listenting to my MP3 player. I use them with Comply tips for amazing noise isolation. I strongly recommend these headphones for audiophiles.
customer_reviews.author: Roger J.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good iem for the money
customer_reviews.text: Warm sound with nicely textured and forward mids/vocals. The bass has good quantity with a slight emphasis as long as you have a good seal, they are not lacking bass at all unless you are a bass head coming from beats/bose headphones. The treble is laid back which gives these a smooth and laid back sound, but they are not lacking detail. The best iem in its price range for vocals
customer_reviews.author: AmazoCustomesr

customer_reviews.title: These are a fake. Save your money
customer_reviews.text: These IEMs are a fake. The sound is horrible. Sound quality is subjective, so please look at the photo of what I received-- the audio jack is completely different. This was not a mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound Great But Don't Last
customer_reviews.text: I am on my second pair of RE-400. They sounds great and I find them comfortable to wear for prolonged periods. The issue I have had with both is the plug failing. I primarily use them on flights so it is not as if the plug gets alot of abuse. I think I'll go back to the Shure 215.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler - VA

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good but I must have received a faulty unit
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of new headphones and heard good things about these so I bought a pair. When I first tried these out after getting them I noticed that they sounded excellent; they were very clear and very balanced and I felt like I was able to hear every instrument in the mix. However, I've had them for a week and since then the volume of the left earbud has become significantly quieter than that of the right. For a second, I thought it was just my computer's speakers, but then I plugged them into my phone and the balance was still incredibly off. These headphones would be really great if only they were properly balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Clear and Clean Sound
customer_reviews.text: These seem to isolate various instruments (sometimes voices) so you can hear a lot more of what is going on. The one drawback is that the sounds don't mix with each other quite as much as some other earbuds or earphones. But, for the price, they are a bargain if they last.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Snipes

customer_reviews.title: the image i get doesn't sound like its coming from in front of me
customer_reviews.text: really detailed, but lacks a stage. when i listen to it, the image i get doesn't sound like its coming from in front of me, but more like directly to my left and right ear. I'm still at the break in stage so i'll update when i've listen to it for a few weeks to see if theres any change. Day 2: its amazying what a day of using has made with these. the issue i had previously has gone away. this thing sounds incredible. probably the best sounding IEM i currently own.
customer_reviews.author: ITMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, poor durability
customer_reviews.text: The left earbud wire became unglued already, short time after purchase, with only gentle use. I will ask for a replacement or refund when I get back home.
customer_reviews.author: william X. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great but fragile
customer_reviews.text: I've had them four months and the wiring has frayed away causing one speaker to not work. I'm very careful to not wrap the wiring up or get it caught on anything. Great sound but very disappointed with the construction.
customer_reviews.author: Cf

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!  Poorly made and hard to use!!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give these zero stars. I didn't even get to try the sound quality because I tried to put on the bigger ear bud pads and they were impossible to get on. Plus there are zero instructions. I have bought cheap $10 headphones at Staples that were easier to use. Will be returning these ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Cary

customer_reviews.title: Don't have to worry about exaggerated boomy bass
customer_reviews.text: This got good reviews on CNET which I found mystifying. The sound is tinny and thin. But it does come with a nice carrying case. Kind of reminds me of those cigarette cases from the old days.
customer_reviews.author: carpecarpium

customer_reviews.title: Good sound questionable quality
customer_reviews.text: Cable detached from right ear after 2 months of light use. Very disappointed as they do sound good. Comfortable for small ears.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Get a good seal between your ears and the earphones.
customer_reviews.text: Try out the different earphone covers that get a good fit in your ears. These in ear head phones sound fantastic. Crystal clear highs and deep well rounded bass. These are excellent sounding in ear headphones. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Baty

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding value and it is hard to believe that you get the quality that you get for such little money. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo V Aguinaga

customer_reviews.title: Still suffering from poor construction and QA checks.
customer_reviews.text: The set I received proved to be defective within a week. Opted for a refund and will not try further headphones from HiFiMan. They have a reputation for outstanding sound and terrible build quality and it is apparent now that this is still the case. I might consider trying them again at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: These certainly sound very detailed and clean, but I just didn't like their signature, or lack there of. For reference I much prefer my warmer sounding Klipsch X10, just as detailed Yamaha EPH-100, and more dynamic Dunu DN-1000. Maybe a flat response just isn't my thing, but i did not enjoy them the way I had hoped even after 3 weeks of listening . Amazon was great with the returns as always.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Quaid

customer_reviews.title: What a mistake.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourselves a favor, DON'T BUY THIS!!!! They sound awful.
customer_reviews.author: Skogkatt

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy these
customer_reviews.text: Very very shoddy build quality in the cabling/plug, started having sound issues within the first 6 months of average use. At this point, 2 years later, they're completely unusable as there's literally 0 sound reaching the drivers. Two stars because they sound decent but it's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D. K. Schrute III

customer_reviews.title: best sounding IEM under $100 but doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: These are by FAR the best sounding IEM you can buy under $100 ... and probably one of the best you can get under $500. Unfortunately as others have noted, the build quality does not match the sound quality. Expect to have to replace these within a year of normal use. The weakest points are the flimsy cable and the shroud around the 3.5mm plug. Hopefully HiFiMan will release an updated model with a more rugged build.
customer_reviews.author: Spray

customer_reviews.title: These are great in-hears! The music is clear and punchy
customer_reviews.text: These are great in-hears! The music is clear and punchy. Outside noises disappear almost entirely with these in--even without music playing! Perfect for drowning out annoyances and really absorbing the music! I had to give them 4 out of 5 just because they make my ears a little sore sometimes--but that could be just that I have very tiny ear canals.
customer_reviews.author: Briana Winchester

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I greatly prefer IEMs to other headphones. I had purchased the Audio Technica M50x's a while back and was slightly underwhelmed. They were uncomfortable after a certain point, and the sound didn't make up for it. With the technicas having been so highly recommended from various sources I was wary of the similarly recommended HiFimans.These, however, are very comfortable, and I found the sound to be superior to the Technicas, despite the difficulty in comparing an in-ear headphone to an over-ear. Having such a beautiful sound at this price inside your head is just wonderful!
customer_reviews.author: Justin G.

customer_reviews.title: Poorly built
customer_reviews.text: I cannot recommend these. The sound is fine but the build quality is so poor I sent them back. If these held up more than a few months I would really be surprised and I didn't want to keep them to find out. I'm really surprised that HiFiman would offer something like this but I should have known since I got rid of the RE-600's as well.
customer_reviews.author: KC33

customer_reviews.title: Great IEMs if you love bass!
customer_reviews.text: While the materials used in this product is somewhat questionable (the hollow aluminum housing, the cheap plastic/rubbery wires from the housing), I will say that these things have great lows and mids. The only problem is the recessed highs, but I bought this for R&B and Electronic so no problems here.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Best audiophile value around
customer_reviews.text: These are mind blowing for the price. You'll hear things you've never heard, in songs you've listened to a thousand times before. Sound profile is a little flat if you like your bass hard and heavy. But if you want clarity, you'll spend a lot more to match these.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: These headphones are absolutely wonderful for everything above 100hz
customer_reviews.text: I sent these headphones back because I wanted more (sub 100hz) low end. I really wish I would have kept them. These headphones are absolutely wonderful for everything above 100hz. Everything under 100hz, you can't even equalize to sound well because it's non-existent. The sound quality for everything above 100hz on these is worth 4 or 5x the price.
customer_reviews.author: CD05

customer_reviews.title: Not 100 dollar earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Really awful sound quality. The speaker on my phone sounds far better than these do. I bought them for the rediculous deal of almost 75% off, but after recieving them I have a hard time beliving these were ever sold at the retail price listed. These are, without a doubt, 20 dollar earbuds not 100 dollar selling for 20.
customer_reviews.author: Darius E.N.

customer_reviews.title: Also use Comply Tx-200 instead of 400 for better seal. Now I prefer my RE-400 over ER4P
customer_reviews.text: Initially I was not impressed. I was using the stock tips. I was not getting enough bass. After that I switched to Comply TX-200 tips and inserted them deep inside my ears and the signature changed drastically with deep rumbling bass and smooth treble. Note that you need very deep insertion to get the missing bass and eliminate any sibilance. Also I use Comply Tx-200 instead of Tx-400 for better seal. Now I prefer my RE-400 over ER4P, Shozy Zero, Carbo tenore, Brainwaivz M2, Sony MDR 7750. The sound is warm and very linear. I can use them for hours without any fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: sflyer

customer_reviews.title: For 50 perhaps you might get a much better product. This one is morally obsolete
customer_reviews.text: They performed way below my expectations form by a CNET extremely positive review. For 50 perhaps you might get a much better product. This one is morally obsolete.
customer_reviews.author: Dimitar Kambourov

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound, but QA is suspect
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife to run with.This is the second pair I have had now and the first one the left side channel is starting to go out after a year of abuse. These sound excellent to me, but I did take a star off due to the side going bad which for the $100 I paid for them shouldn't have done so.
customer_reviews.author: The Gadgeteer

customer_reviews.title: Seriously the best headphones I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the best headphones I've ever owned. Just great, crisp all-around sound that makes music come alive and listening to podcasts crystal clear. The first pair I ordered eventually had the left ear start to cut out when I turned my head certain angles, but the RMA process was easy and customer service was prompt in getting me another pair ASAP. HiFiMAN rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Bret Lien

customer_reviews.title: They literally do not work. The first pair I ...
customer_reviews.text: They literally do not work. The first pair I ordered, I quickly noticed that one ear would sometimes become nearly silent. I got a replacement for these headphones, and they worked for a little while. However, soon enough, the same problem came up again. Unfortunately, I was out of the window for replacement. Do not make the same mistake as me. Do not order these headphones, because they have SERIOUS quality control issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound but cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Used them at work for 5 or so months, a few months in the wires started coming undone from the buds and now the quality is worse so now they're pretty much garbage, barely 6 months from purchase.
customer_reviews.author: yankes77

customer_reviews.title: Good earbuds, but the plastic protectors connecting the metal ...
customer_reviews.text: Good earbuds, but the plastic protectors connecting the metal piece to the black wire slid off on one side rather quickly. Then the wire kinked inside the thread sheath lower down and I had to snip the threads. Generally those types of issues don't bother me but I figured people would be interested.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had these headphones very long, but so far I really like them. I bought these to replace a pair of Shure SE-215s that broke. These heaphones are definitely more neutral than the SE-215s. Overall the sound is definitely of the same quality, even if the sound signature isn't the same. These are much more comfortable then the 215s, though, and are easier to listen to for long periods. I can't comment on durability, since I haven't had these long.
customer_reviews.author: G Brown

customer_reviews.title: Nice mids and treble
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as "Audiophile"...decent sound, especially through an amp. I use these w/ a helmet while motorcycling, so not really loud enough to be critical. Nice mids and treble, bass lacking. Supposed to have more bass sound. Perhaps I haven't spent enough time trying all the ear bud possibilities.
customer_reviews.author: Trum

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These fit my ears perfectly to block out exterior noises, and sound really great. Love them.
customer_reviews.author: S.K.

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Bass?
customer_reviews.text: Nice form factor, beautiful treble and nice midrange, decent mid bass (fairly punchy and accurate), but sub bass is very rolled off. I would have given them a 4 or maybe even a 5 star if the low end wasn't so missing. To help put this review in perspective, I found the Xiaomi Piston 2 to have overblown bass (still a great listen) and the Zero Audio Carbo Tenore to have very close to accurate bass response if a tad eccentuated.
customer_reviews.author: Tig

customer_reviews.title: Decent in ears
customer_reviews.text: These sound very good for the price. Clear highs and detailed lows with a wider soundstage. Do get some cable noise even when worn over ear while excercising, but it's not horrible
customer_reviews.author: Rojax

customer_reviews.title: 3 Month Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Pros: One of the best, clearest sounding headphones I have ever owned... until they fell apart. Cons: After 3 months, left side began to cut out and plastic cable housing separated from right earbud shortly after. Thoughts: HifiMan's website is lacking to say the least. I followed what little information they had on returns for replacement but after emailing them several times its been 3 weeks and I still have not heard back from customer service. This is all a shame because I really did enjoy the headphones while they worked, for this price I expected better quality and better customer service but I was let down on both counts. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Foghorn Leghorn

customer_reviews.title: BAD DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: was pretty good while it lasted. the stress relievers broke within 4 months. then the wires going in the housing broke due to the lack of a stress reliever. ive already gone through 2 of these re-400 because of this. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Arma

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I received these earbuds on December 26, 2014. After very light use, sometime on or before February 20, 2015, the left ear bud stopped working. Per Amazons return policy, this item was no longer eligible for return as of January 31, approximately one month after receipt of the product. These earbuds sounded great, they were small and lightweight, but one or the other ear failing seems to be a common problem. They were too expensive for such poor quality. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Randellb

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality if the player has a good output
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound quality if the player has a good output. Sound from my iPhone is great, but sound from my laptop is not great. NEutral sound - does not amplify bass.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it's just me, but I prefer more bass
customer_reviews.text: Probably I am used to more bassy headphones, these have a very midrange pronounced sound. A lot of people are swearing for it, but I did not enjoy using these that much. Sounds better through a Huawei P10 smartphone (not really great audio-wise) than when using my old iPod nano. I am sure I need to look into more foam heads options, will revisit the review if that will make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Vasile Pop

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. Decent sound quality but not as rugged ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Decent sound quality but not as rugged as I'd have hoped. The cable strain relievers don't last long, especially if you wear them over your ear (as recommended). Only a matter of time once they pop out of the body before the cable will start to fray.
customer_reviews.author: Ben B.

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound for the money. Extremely comfortable fit. Cable is a little prone to tangle and a little stiff with the fabric cover. Overall really good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A.

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones but not that great of build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones but not that great of build quality. They sound wonderful for earbuds but unless you are going to put them back in the case after each use and be delicate with them they will break. The right earbud went out after two months of listening
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Waterline Indeed
customer_reviews.text: High quality cable, light weight earbuds, clear well formed sound. Cliche of the day: I forgot i had these on and was just enjoying the audio
customer_reviews.author: Sami M Mohammed

customer_reviews.title: Bad in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: These headphones exclusively sit on my desk and do not experience any wear and tear, the left ear is probably about half as loud as the right, should not happen with a $40 pair of earbuds, i've had $10 pairs last longer
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is great though, just needs better construction
customer_reviews.text: Cabling gave out in 9 months and the braided portion started to come undone. Sound quality is great though, just needs better construction.
customer_reviews.author: D. N.

customer_reviews.title: recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, balanced sound (may seem weak on the bass to some but it's more accurate). I'm mildly concerned about build quality but after more than a year of fairly gentle use I haven't had issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: beautifully made
customer_reviews.text: Great set of IEMs for the money. I'd compare them to the Zero Audio Tenores, but a bit less natural sounding. The build quality is much better than the Tenores however. Still looking for some tips to give me a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent inexpensive IEM Well balanced sound slightly rolled off in ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent inexpensive IEM Well balanced sound slightly rolled off in the bottom end low bass - its there just not loud. Fine for quiet listening environments but in an active or noisy setting some low bass is lost. Other than that they are great sounding. Very small and light weight. Very much worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: FWS5

customer_reviews.title: Very tinny sound.
customer_reviews.text: You can find something much better at a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: broke in 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Horrible quality. 3 months after purchase the are falling apart. The cable is coming out of the housing. Have never even taken these out of the house. Too late to return to Amazon, now have to battle with a company overseas.
customer_reviews.author: William B Manns

customer_reviews.title: Missing items edit
customer_reviews.text: I found the missing items! I will give 5 stars for now
customer_reviews.author: Carl Yanowitz

product_meta.title: HIFIMAN RE400 in-Ear Monitor-Hi Fi Earphone/Earbud
product_meta.description: Consumer Alert: For Your Protection HIFIMAN products are sold through carefully selected, authorized retail partners to ensure the highest levels of professionalism and service. HIFIMAN products not sold by us, or one of our authorized partners, cannot be verified as authentic and will not receive the HIFIMAN manufacturer's warranty or factory service. Before purchasing, please verify that you are dealing with an authorized HIFIMAN retail partner. You can do that by checking our official website. Help us help you.
feature_bullets: Driver designed and manufactured by HifiMAN

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars575 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
